document.discussion_title: The Container Store Group’s (TCS) Hold Rating Reaffirmed at JPMorgan Chase & Co.
document.topic_text: Tweet JPMorgan Chase & Co. reiterated their hold rating on shares of The Container Store Group Inc. (NYSE:TCS) in a research note published on Tuesday. The Container Store Group ( NYSE:TCS ) opened at 5.30 on Tuesday. The company’s 50-day moving average is $5.56 and its 200 day moving average is $5.55. The stock has a market capitalization of $256.30 million and a price-to-earnings ratio of 49.53. The Container Store Group has a one year low of $3.77 and a one year high of $17.70. The Container Store Group (NYSE:TCS) last posted its quarterly earnings results on Tuesday, August 9th. The company reported ($0.04) earnings per share for the quarter, beating the consensus estimate of ($0.10) by $0.06. During the same period last year, the company earned ($0.11) EPS. The firm earned $177.40 million during the quarter, compared to analysts’ expectations of $848.70 million. The business’s quarterly revenue was up 4.5% on a year-over-year basis. Equities analysts expect that The Container Store Group will post $0.22 EPS for the current year. Other analysts have also recently issued research reports about the stock. Zacks Investment Research cut shares of The Container Store Group from a hold rating to a strong sell rating in a research note on Thursday, April 28th. Jefferies Group reissued a hold rating on shares of The Container Store Group in a research note on Tuesday, April 26th. Finally, Goldman Sachs Group Inc. increased their price target on shares of The Container Store Group from $5.75 to $7.50 and gave the company a neutral rating in a research note on Tuesday, April 26th. Two research analysts have rated the stock with a sell rating, seven have given a hold rating and one has given a buy rating to the company. The company has an average rating of Hold and a consensus target price of $9.00. A number of large investors have added to or reduced their stakes in TCS. Geode Capital Management LLC raised its stake in The Container Store Group by 20.6% in the first quarter. Geode Capital Management LLC now owns 113,420 shares of the company’s stock worth $665,000 after buying an additional 19,381 shares during the period. Sanders Morris Harris Inc. acquired a new stake in The Container Store Group during the first quarter worth about $285,000. Jacobs Levy Equity Management Inc. acquired a new stake in The Container Store Group during the first quarter worth about $303,000. A.R.T. Advisors LLC acquired a new stake in The Container Store Group during the first quarter worth about $368,000. Finally, Renaissance Technologies LLC raised its stake in The Container Store Group by 586.9% in the first quarter. Renaissance Technologies LLC now owns 83,800 shares of the company’s stock worth $492,000 after buying an additional 71,600 shares during the period. The Container Store Group, Inc is a specialty retailer of storage and organization products in the United States. The Company is the original storage and organization specialty retailer. The Company operates in two segments: TCS and Elfa. TCS segment consists of its retail stores, ebsite and call center. The Container Store Group Inc. The Container Store Group Inc.
